intro: Pycnocoma brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked pycnocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a compact, shrub-like form. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers, which appear in clusters, are small and yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
